title: Sophisticated search
description: Faceted, full-text, and model-aware search lets scientists pinpoint records across billions of rows in milliseconds.

title: Data visualizations
description: Built-in dashboards render interactive plots, heat maps, and dimension-reduced embeddings directly from live project data—no exporting required.

title: Self-Service Curation at Scale
description: Scientists can load and publish their own data while hub curators review; FaceBase used this model to surpass 1,000 datasets and 30 projects in two years.

title: Flexible Ingest & Metadata QC
description: Command-line and Python tools bulk-load any file types, attach controlled-vocabulary metadata, and trigger automated QC dashboards for “self-curation” at scale.

title: Versioned, Provenance-Aware Storage
description: Hatrac object store + BagIt/BDBag packages + Minid persistent IDs guarantee fixity, trace every revision, and make dataset exchange reproducible and cache-friendly.

title: Fine-Grained Federated Access Control
description: [Globus Auth & Groups] let projects enforce reader/writer/curator roles, embargoes, and single-sign-on with ORCID, Google, or campus IDs—critical for cross-institution work.

title: Integrated ML Workflow Support (Deriva-ML)
description: A Python library plus GPU-enabled JupyterHub pulls curated datasets, tracks executions, captures configs & results, and pushes them back with provenance—ideal for reproducible AI pipelines.

title: Loosely-Coupled, Brandable Architecture
description: Micro-services with public APIs, style/theming hooks, and adaptive UI let each consortium stand up a branded portal yet share the same battle-tested core.

title: Proven Multi-Domain Track Record
description: Deployed in neuroscience, craniofacial biology, ophthalmology ML, and more—demonstrating adaptability and accelerated discovery across disciplines.
